stressed countries where access to water for drinking, cooking and washing is not guaranteed

which are increasing with climate change

text: Well I think clay can be used to smooth the skin on people's faces

Lack of water and farming are closely connected
Agriculture uses a massive 70% of the world's fresh water supply
so ways to use water more efficiently are much needed
Oles-Sivitzen's company Desert Control works with date farmers in Yuma
an area on the border of California and Mexico
One of the hottest places on earth, Yuma has been experiencing its worst drought in 500 years
forcing farmers to pump water from rivers to grow their date palm trees
Fortunately, Oles team have created a liquid that they say
can turn the sandy desert soil into a sponge which holds water and nutrients
Here he explains his invention to Anthony Wallace
reporter for BBC World Service program People Fixing the World
To understand how it works we need to look at the difference between sandy soil and clay soil
sandy desert soil has a lot of gaps in it
so water drains through it quickly making it harder for plants to establish a root system in the ground
but clay soil is made up of much smaller particles that cling together and naturally stop water from escaping
It creates the habitat for the soil microbiology to also start to develop and evolve, so it's kind of a kick-start as well to nature's natural processes.

text: so it's kind of a kickstart as well to nature's natural processes
The problem with sandy soil is that it drains water
if you drain something you remove the liquid from it
Clay soil on the other hand is made of smaller particles which cling or stick together tightly
and hold water helping plants grow
Oles makes a liquid by mixing clay and water which changes the soil composition
and kick starts the growth of his trees
the liquid makes the trees start growing more quickly
liquid clay technology is still new and costing around $2,000 an acre
it's not cheap but Oles claims his technique halves the amount of water needed to grow fruit trees
and that most farmers will make back their investment within two years
Oles claims sound too good to be true but are there downsides to interfering with nature in this way
presenters Myra and Nubi and Anthony Wallace discuss this question for BBC World Services
People Fixing the World

if you kick start something you make it start or develop more quickly
to manipulate means to skillfully use or control something
the phrase down the line means sometime in the future
